Considering the food-borne risks associated with cockroaches, their presence should not be tolerated in the food industry. Similarly, cockroaches should not be tolerated in the hospital setting as they might spread nosocomial pathogens such as S. aureus and E. coli. Efforts to control cockroaches should involve good hygiene and sanitation of facilities and also the application of proper insecticides to cockroach hiding spots.
4, 76, 77 It is also important to remove hiding places of cockroaches such as cardboard, as this will prevent future infestations.
